intro: Leichhardtia neomicrostoma, commonly known as the narrow-leafed leichhardtia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the eastern coast of Australia, particularly Queensland and New South Wales. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
